de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface HeaderDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimateableDialog, ButtonBarDialog, HeaderDialog, ListDialog, ScrollableDialog, ValidateableDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnimateableDialog, AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractHeaderDialog, AbstractHeaderDialogFragment, AbstractListDialog, AbstractScrollableDialog, AbstractValidateableDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, ProgressDialog, WizardDialog

    public interface HeaderDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface of a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        Dialog.Gravity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        MATCH_PARENT, WRAP_CONTENT

    • Method Detail

      • isHeaderShown

        boolean isHeaderShown()
        Returns, whether the dialog's header is shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the dialog's header is shown, false otherwise

      • showHeader

        void showHeader(boolean show)
        Sets, whether the dialog's header should be shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the dialog's header should be shown, false otherwise

      • getHeaderHeight

        int getHeaderHeight()
        Returns the height of the dialog's header.
        Returns:
        The height of the dialog's header in pixels as an Integer value

      • setHeaderHeight

        void setHeaderHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the dialog's header.
        Parameters:
        height - The height, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The height must be at least 0

      • getHeaderBackground

        android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getHeaderBackground()
        Returns the background of the dialog's header.
        Returns:
        The background of the dialog's header as an instance of the class Drawable

      • setHeaderBackground

        void setHeaderBackground(@Nullable
                         android.graphics.Bitmap background)
        Sets the background of the dialog's header.
        Parameters:
        background - The background, which should be set, as an instance of the class Bitmap or null, if no background should be shown

      • setHeaderBackground

        void setHeaderBackground(@Nullable
                         android.graphics.Bitmap background,
                         @Nullable
                         BackgroundAnimation animation)
        Sets the background of the dialog's header.
        Parameters:
        background - The background, which should be set, as an instance of the class Bitmap or null, if no background should be shown
        animation - The animation, which should be used to change the background, as an instance of the class BackgroundAnimation or null, if no animation should be used

      • setHeaderBackground

        void setHeaderBackground(@DrawableRes
                         int resourceId)
        Sets the background of the dialog's header.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the background, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource

                         int resourceId,

        animation - The animation, which should be used to change the background, as an instance of the class BackgroundAnimation or null, if no animation should be used
